intro: Guatteria costaricensis subsp. panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in the tropical regions of Panama and Costa Rica. This evergreen shrub or small tree typically grows in humid, lowland forests and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale green, followed by edible, fleshy berries. It plays an important role in the ecological balance of its habitat by providing food for various wildlife species.
